greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Theta series of quadratic form x^2 + x*y + 11*y^2.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of theta_3(q) * theta_3(q^43) + theta_2(q) * theta_2(q^43) in powers of q.
Expansion of phi(q) * phi(q^43) + 4 * q^11 * psi(q^2) * psi(q^86) in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
a(n) = 2*b(n) where b() is multiplicative with b(43^e) = 1, b(p^e) = e + 1 if Kronecker(-43, p) = 1, b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 otherwise.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (43 t)) = 43^(1/2) (t/i) f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
G.f.: Sum_{i,j in Z} x^(i*i + i*j + 11*j*j).
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, Boole[n == 0], 2 DivisorSum[ n, KroneckerSymbol[ -43, #] &]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 07 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q^43] + EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^43], {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 07 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, sumdiv(n, d, kronecker(-43, d))*2)};
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( 1 + 2 * x * Ser(qfrep([2, 1; 1, 22], n, 1)), n))};
xref: Number of integer solutions to f(x,y) = n where f(x,y) is the principal binary quadratic form with discriminant d: A004016 (d=-3), A004018 (d=-4), A002652 (d=-7), A033715 (d=-8), A028609 (d=-11), A028641 (d=-19), this sequence (d=-43).
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 31 2008, Apr 05 2008
